page.title: 01South Middleton
page.content: South Middleton Deserted Village is considered by Hoskins to be one of the best in the country. The streets and house sites show up in an are that can not be ploughed. Ridge and furrow show the old open fields. Devils Causeway passes through the area. On Shaftoe Crags are a native settlement and hill fort with a tumulus and standing stone prominent nearby. Grassland has been improved,rough pasture reseeded. Some corn and forage crops are grown,more silage and less hay. Middleton Mill is dairy farm with milk around. The area is very attractive to view with fringes of crags clumps of trees and meandering Wansbeck. Bolam Country Park is to south and Bolam village to east. Wallington lies to the west. The railway from Morpeth to Scots Gap closed in 1962. School buses are the only public transport.
